item.title: Philosophy Of Commemoration And Remembrance
item.description:
In collaboration with the UW History Society, Dr Geoff Hayes, and Dr Nick Ray, we are excited to announce our next event: Philosophy of Commemoration and Remembrance.
The event will feature a panel-style discussion between Professors Dr Hayes and Dr Ray, as they answer questions about history and philosophy. There will be a special focus on how we study, teach, and remember the past - especially in the age of AI and digital memory.
The event will include a Q & A period for questions from the audience.
WHEN: Wednesday November 12th, 6:00-7:30pm WHERE: HH 117 (MacKirdy Reading Room)
We hope you join us for a night of conversion and reflection. Snacks and drinks will be provided.

item.title: Change Engine: Live Competition Night
item.description:
Fans of Dragonâ€™s Den, This Oneâ€™s for You! Do you love seeing bold ideas, creative pitches, and real solutions come to life? Then get ready to cheer for your fellow students at the Change Engine Competition where innovation meets advocacy and ideas turn into action! Think Dragonâ€™s Den or Shark Tank, but with the heart of Waterlooâ€™s brightest changemakers. Watch advocacy ideas turn into real impact on campus, and maybe even spark some of your own. Whatâ€™s Happening? Six student teams will take the stage to pitch their visionary projects aimed at solving real issues on campus, to our panel of judges in a live competition. Theyâ€™re not just pitching, theyâ€™re competing for funding, mentorship, and the opportunity to make a lasting impact on our student community. Whatâ€™s in it for you?
Witness real innovation as students present transformative ideas for campus life. Be inspired by the passion and creativity of your peers. Support a student-led movement to create meaningful change. Enjoy free refreshments, networking opportunities, and the chance to win a $100 door prize!
Seats are limited, RSVP now. Donâ€™t just let history happen â€“ be part of it. Curious what itâ€™s like? Check out last yearâ€™s highlights to see how student changemakers brought their ideas to life.

item.title: Maaveerar Naal: Our Heroes, Our Legacy
item.description:
In honour of the fallen heroes of the Tamileelam community, UWATNA and LUTSA dedicate the month of November to remember and pay tribute to their sacrifices made for the freedom and progress of our people. Each year, Tamils around the world unite in this month of remembrance to celebrate the courage and resilience of our Maaveerars.
The University of Waterloo Tamil Networking Association (UWATNA), in collaboration with the Laurier University Tamil Studentsâ€™ Association (LUTSA), invites you to our Campus Maaveerar Naal Commemoration Ceremony, â€˜Our Heroes, Our Legacy,â€™ time to reflect, remember, and honour the enduring legacy of our heroes whose bravery, sacrifice, and unity continue to inspire generations of Tamils worldwide
ðŸ—“ï¸ | Wednesday, November 19th, 2025â€¨â° | 7:00 PM â€“ 9:00 PMâ€¨ðŸ“ | Black and Gold Room, University of Waterlooâ€¨ðŸ‘” | Please wear black to show solidarity
Let us come together to pay our respects to those who gave everything for our freedom, and ensure their legacy lives on forever.

item.title: F25 EngPlay: Peter Johnson, The Tool Thief
item.description:
Come see "EngPlay Presents: Peter Johnson: The Tool Thief", a legally distinct engineering parody of godly proportions. Peter Johnson discovers he's not like everyone else, and he and his friends embark on a harrowing journey of self-discovery, hijinks, and a little bit of debauchery to prevent a war among the Eng-gods. Performances are held on November 20th and November 21st at the Humanities Theatre, doors open at 6:30 pm. Heckling is encouraged. Enjoy at your own risk.
Venue: Humanities Theatre, Hagey Hall, University of Waterloo Tickets: $12.81

item.title: Womenâ€™s Centre X Glow Centre Chest Casting Workshop
item.description:
Join the Womenâ€™s Centre and Glow on Friday, November 21 in the Womenâ€™s Centre (SLC 3104) for an event celebrating your body in a safe environment! Create a plaster cast of your chest as a way to honour and connect with your body.
No matter the size and shape of your bust, every woman-identifying person and non-binary-identifying person is welcome at the event!
There will also be a discussion on the sexualization and feminization of chests, and how these narratives can perpetuate transphobia and body image issues. Together, weâ€™ll explore new ways of seeing our bodies to help foster more positive and affirming self-perception.
Three FREE sessions are available: 11AM â€“ 12 PM 1 PM â€“ 2 PM 3 PM â€“ 4 PM* Glow Centre â€“ run session
Registration will be open from November 3 through November 21 at 3 p.m., or until all available spots are filled. Please register early to secure your place using the link below!
âš ï¸ Accessibility, Comfort & Health Notice
This is a messy craft activity using paper mÃ¢chÃ© materials, so please wear clothes you donâ€™t mind getting dirty.
Participants will remove clothing from their upper body in a small, private group setting (about 10 people). We understand this can feel vulnerable â€” please know itâ€™s a safe and body-positive space, and you can opt out or pause at any time.
If you have allergies, skin sensitivities, or accessibility needs, please contact us in advance so we can make accommodations.
This event is exclusive to Waterloo undergrad students.

item.description:

item.title: University of Waterloo Accounting Conference 2025
item.description:
The UWAC Team is thrilled to announce that registration for UWAC 2025 is now open! Register for a chance to compete for cash prizes, build valuable skills through sponsor-led workshops, and connect with students and industry professionals at Canadaâ€™s leading undergraduate accounting conference! The conference will take place on Saturday, November 22nd, hosted at Hagey Hall on the University of Waterloo campus.
Teams will consist of four members, and you can either register with a group of friends or let us assign you a team. The registration deadline is FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 7TH at 11:59 PM, but sign up before November 2nd to take advantage of our early bird pricing and save $10!
Early bird pricing (until November 2nd): $20 Regular pricing: $30
Sign up by paying for the ticket on the WUSA website AND submitting your application using our Google Form (https://forms.gle/zucuboQK1KwnkXKs9). You must complete BOTH forms to officially register! Spots are limited and will be assigned on a first-come, first-served basis, so make sure every team member signs up!
For any questions or concerns, reach out to us at info@uwac.ca or through our social media. We canâ€™t wait to see you at the conference on November 22nd!
